identificationModule.briefTitle: Transthoracic Echocardiography of Ventricular Function of Parturients in Labor
identificationModule.officialTitle: Transthoracic Echocardiography of Cardiac Function of Parturients in Labor

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This echocardiography study will characterize heart structure and function during labor. Imaging of the heart during the stress of labor could increase detection of subclinical cardiovascular disease using advanced imaging techniques. Cardiac serum biomarkers and complication rates will also be measured and compared between patients with and without evidence of cardiovascular disease on echocardiography.

primaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of patients with an abnormal strain pattern as compared to parturients not in labor
The proportion of patients with diastolic dysfunction as compared to parturients not in labor

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing estimated right ventricular systolic pressure between patients in active labor as compared to those who are not in active labor (mm Hg)

otherOutcomes.measure: Left ventricular systolic function
otherOutcomes.description: Simpson's method of discs motion abnormalities and diastolic function

otherOutcomes.measure: Left ventricular myocardial performance index
Total number of patients with the presence of regional wall motion abnormalities
Total number of patients with abnormal global right ventricular dysfunction
Right ventricular strain
Tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion
Tissue doppler s'
Total number of maternal deaths within 0-42 days post-partum
The number of patients with an identifiable Centers for Disease Control Severe Maternal Morbidity Identification complication post-partum
otherOutcomes.description: Acute myocardial infarction, aortic aneurysm, acute renal failure, adult respiratory distress syndrome, amniotic fluid embolism, cardiac arrest, ventricular fibrillation, conversion of cardiac rhythm, disseminated intravascular coagulation, eclampsia, heart failure, arrest during surgery or procedure, puerperal cerebrovascular disorders, pulmonary edema, aspiration, cardiopulmonary anesthesia complications, sepsis, shock, air or thrombotic embolism, blood product transfusion, hysterectomy, temporary tracheostomy, requiring ventilation

otherOutcomes.measure: The number of patients with a pulse oximetry reading <90% after delivery
The number of patients who required oxygen administration after delivery
The number of patients who develop atrial fibrillation or premature atrial complexes
The number of patients who develop a stroke
otherOutcomes.description: Stroke must be verified by imaging including either computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging.

otherOutcomes.measure: The number of patients with an elevation in transaminase levels during labor or after delivery
Hospital length of stay
otherOutcomes.description: Total hours from admission to discharge

otherOutcomes.measure: The number of patients requiring intensive care unit admission within 42 days post delivery
Mortality within 42 days post delivery
The number of patients with a post-partum diagnosis of post-partum hemorrhage
The total number of patients who require additional uterotonic medications other than oxytocin after delivery
otherOutcomes.description: Medications include additional dosage of oxytocin above 3 units, methylergonovine, carboprost, tranexamic acid or misoprostol

otherOutcomes.measure: The number of patients requiring a transfusion
otherOutcomes.description: Cell Saver, red blood cells, platelets, fresh frozen plasma, cryoprecipitate

otherOutcomes.measure: Blood loss
otherOutcomes.description: Estimated and quantitated blood loss as well as the difference between pre-delivery hemoglobin and post-delivery lowest hemoglobin during admission

otherOutcomes.measure: Number of patients requiring vasopressor after delivery to support blood pressure
otherOutcomes.description: phenylephrine, ephedrine, norepinephrine, epinephrine, vasopressin, inhaled nitrous oxide, inhaled epoprostenol

otherOutcomes.measure: Activin A level
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Less than 3 hours after echocardiogram procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Placental Growth Factor
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Less than 3 hours after echocardiogram procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Soluble endoglin
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Less than 3 hours after echocardiogram procedure

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* All healthy parturients 18 years of age or older with estimated gestation greater than or equal to 37 weeks who are expected to deliver during their hospitalization.
* During the echocardiographic exam, the patient must be in active labor with cervical dilation between 6-10 cm and contractions that are spaced less than 5 minutes apart.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known functional or structural heart disease
* Previously diagnosed pulmonary hypertension.
* Comorbid disease other than diet controlled gestational diabetes, uncomplicated obesity, mild asthma and euthyroid patients with a history of hypo or hyperthyroidism.
* Parturients endorsing active use of non-prescription mind-altering drugs including cocaine, methamphetamine, or ketamine.
* Other non-inclusion criteria include inability to tolerate left lateral positioning either symptomatically or by fetal heart rate monitoring, suspected hypo-or hypercoagulable states that was not previously diagnosed, hemodynamic instability requiring \>2 L crystalloid administration within 1 hour time frame after epidural placement or vasopressor administration of \>15 mg ephedrine or \>300 mcg phenylephrine administration within 1 hour after epidural placement.
eligibilityModule.genderDescription: Any pregnant patient, even if gender identity is male.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Healthy women between 18 and 35 years of age with singleton pregnancy in active labor

ancestors.term: Female Urogenital Diseases and Pregnancy Complications
